Name: Lancelot Andrewes
Notes: Andrewes studied at Merchant Taylors ' School and Pembroke Hall , Cambridge and was later Bishop of Chichester , Bishop of Winchester and one of the translators of the King James Bible . He was also named as a Scholar in the 1622 charter

Name: William Aubrey
Notes: A former Regius Professor of Civil Law ( 1553-1559 ) ; reappointed as a Commissioner in the 1589 charter

Name: Nicholas Bacon
Notes: Lord Keeper of the Great Seal under Elizabeth I

Name: William Cecil , Lord Burghley
Notes: Secretary of State and leading adviser to Elizabeth I ; reappointed as a Commissioner in the 1589 charter

Name: The Chancellor or Vice-Chancellor of the university
Notes: The Chancellor at the time of the 1571 charter was Robert Dudley , 1st Earl of Leicester ( Chancellor 1564-1588 , with Sir Thomas Bromley deputising for him between 1585 and 1588 ) . Dudley was succeeded by Sir Christopher Hatton ( Chancellor 1588-1591 ) , who was named as a Commissioner in the 1589 charter . The Vice-Chancellor in 1571 was Lawrence Humphrey . He was succeeded in 1576 by Herbert Westphaling , who was named as a Commissioner in the 1589 charter . After Westphaling , there was a new Vice-Chancellor every year until the 1589 charter

Name: John Cotterell
Notes: Clergyman , formerly Principal of White Hall and Laurence Hall , Oxford

Name: Thomas Dove
Notes: Dove studied at Merchant Taylors ' School and Pembroke Hall , Cambridge . He was also named in the 1622 charter , and became Bishop of Peterborough

Name: Gregory Downhall
Notes: Studied at Merchant Taylors ' School ( where he was a founding scholar ) and Pembroke Hall , Cambridge

Name: William Garth
Notes: Unknown background - no evidence that he matriculated at either Oxford or Cambridge

Name: Gilbert Gerard
Notes: Attorney-General under Elizabeth I ; reappointed as a Commissioner in the 1589 charter

Name: John Higginson
Notes: A Leicestershire priest , named as a Fellow of the college in the 1622 charter

Name: Thomas Huet
Notes: Precentor of St David 's Cathedral ( 1562-1588 )

Name: Thomas Huyck
Notes: Chancellor of the Diocese of London

Name: Robert Johnson
Notes: Later Archdeacon of Leicester and founder of Oakham and Uppingham Schools , and named as a Fellow of the college in the 1622 charter

Name: David Lewis
Notes: First Principal ( resigning 1572 ) ; Fellow of All Souls , former Principal of New Inn Hall , Oxford , a judge of the High Court of Admiralty ( appointed in 1558 )

Name: John Lloyd
Notes: Former Dean of St Asaph , judge of the High Court of Admiralty

Name: Robert Lougher
Notes: Principal of New Inn Hall , Oxford ( 1564-1570 and 1575-1580 ) and Regius Professor of Civil Law ( 1566-1577 )

Name: John Osmand
Notes: Unknown background - no evidence that he matriculated at either Oxford or Cambridge

Name: William Platt
Notes: Studied at Merchant Taylors ' School and Christ 's College , Cambridge

Name: Hugh Price
Notes: Treasurer of St David 's Cathedral and founder of the college , his name appears twice in the charter ( as a benefactor promising a bequest worth Â£60 per year , and then as the first-named Commissioner )
